t: Isaiah 44
God’s Blessing on Israel
“Yet*pn hear now, O Jacob My servant, And*ld Israel whom I have chosen.
Thus*ld says the Lord*s who made you And*ld formed you from the womb, who*i will help you: ‘Fear*ld not, O Jacob My servant; And*ld you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
For*ld I will pour water on him who is thirsty, And*ld floods on the dry ground; I*ld will pour My Spirit on your descendants, And*ld My blessing on your offspring;
They*ld will spring up among the grass Like*ld willows by the watercourses.’
One*ld will say, ‘I am*i the Lord*s ’s’; Another*ld will call himself*i by the name of Jacob; Another*ld will write with*i his hand, ‘The Lord*s ’s,’ And*ld name himself*i by the name of Israel.
There Is No Other God
“Thus*pn says the Lord,*s the King of Israel, And*ld his Redeemer, the Lord*s of hosts: ‘I*ld am*i the First and I am*i the Last; Besides*ld Me there*i is*i no God.

And*ld who can proclaim as I do? Then*ld let him declare it and set it in order for Me, Since*ld I appointed the ancient people. And*ld the things that are coming and shall come, Let*ld them show these to them.

Do*ld not fear, nor be afraid; Have*ld I not told you from that time, and declared it?*i You*ld are*i My witnesses. Is*ld there a God besides Me? Indeed*ld there*i is*i no other Rock; I*ld know not one.’”*i
Idolatry Is Foolishness
Those*pn who make an image, all of them are*i useless, And*ld their precious things shall not profit; They*ld are*i their own witnesses; They*ld neither see nor know, that they may be ashamed.
Who*ld would form a god or mold an image That*ild profits him nothing?

Surely*ld all his companions would be ashamed; And*ld the workmen, they are*i mere men. Let*ld them all be gathered together, Let*ld them stand up; Yet*ld they shall fear, They*ld shall be ashamed together.

The*ln blacksmith with the tongs works one in the coals, Fashions*ld it with hammers, And*ld works it with the strength of his arms. Even*ld so, he is hungry, and his strength fails; He*ld drinks no water and is faint.

The*ln craftsman stretches out his*i rule, He*ld marks one out with chalk; He*ld fashions it with a plane, He*ld marks it out with the compass, And*ld makes it like the figure of a man, According*ld to the beauty of a man, that it may remain in the house.
He*ld cuts down cedars for himself, And*ld takes the cypress and the oak; He*ld secures it*i for himself among the trees of the forest. He*ld plants a pine, and the rain nourishes it.*i

Then*ln it shall be for a man to burn, For*ld he will take some of it and warm himself; Yes,*ld he kindles it*i and bakes bread; Indeed*ld he makes a god and worships it;*i He*ld makes it a carved image, and falls down to it.
He*ld burns half of it in the fire; With*ld this half he eats meat; He*ld roasts a roast, and is satisfied. He*ld even warms himself*i and says, “Ah!*ld I am warm, I*ld have seen the fire.”
And*ld the rest of it he makes into a god, His*ld carved image. He*ld falls down before it and worships it,*i Prays*ld to it and says, “Deliver*ld me, for you are*i my god!”
They*ln do not know nor understand; For*ld He has shut their eyes, so that they cannot see, And*ild their hearts, so that they cannot understand.

And*ld no one considers in his heart, Nor*ld is*i there*i knowledge nor understanding to say, “I*ld have burned half of it in the fire, Yes,*ld I have also baked bread on its coals; I*ld have roasted meat and eaten it;*i And*ld shall I make the rest of it an abomination? Shall*ld I fall down before a block of wood?”
He*ld feeds on ashes; A*ld deceived heart has turned him aside; And*ld he cannot deliver his soul, Nor*ld say, “Is*i there*i not a lie in my right hand?”
Israel Is Not Forgotten
“Remember*pn these, O Jacob, And*ld Israel, for you are*i My servant; I*ld have formed you, you are*i My servant; O*ld Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me!
I*ld have blotted out, like a thick cloud, your transgressions, And*ld like a cloud, your sins. Return*ld to Me, for I have redeemed you.”

Sing,*ln O heavens, for the Lord*s has done it!*i Shout,*ld you lower parts of the earth; Break*ld forth into singing, you mountains, O*ld forest, and every tree in it! For*ld the Lord*s has redeemed Jacob, And*ld glorified Himself in Israel.
Judah Will Be Restored

Thus*pn says the Lord,*s your Redeemer, And*ld He who formed you from the womb: “I*ld am*i the Lord,*s who makes all things,*i Who*ld stretches out the heavens all alone, Who*ld spreads abroad the earth by Myself;
Who*ld frustrates the signs of the babblers, And*ld drives diviners mad; Who*ld turns wise men backward, And*ld makes their knowledge foolishness;

Who*ld confirms the word of His servant, And*ld performs the counsel of His messengers; Who*ld says to Jerusalem, ‘You shall be inhabited,’ To*ld the cities of Judah, ‘You shall be built,’ And*ld I will raise up her waste places;
Who*ld says to the deep, ‘Be dry! And*ld I will dry up your rivers’;
Who*ld says of Cyrus, ‘He*i is*i My shepherd, And*ld he shall perform all My pleasure, Saying*ld to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,” And*ld to the temple, “Your foundation shall be laid.”’
